_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

(Revised in accordance with EPA's requirements for the five year update.)



A.  Introduction

Crop Production Services is a supplier of fertilizer, agrichemical, seed and other inputs to farmers.  The primary activity at this facility is diluting anhydrous ammonia in a conversion process to produce aqua ammonia to be used as a liquid fertilizer for direct field application by growers.  This facility has an excellent safety record with no deaths or serious injuries to plant personnel or contractors due to the RMP covered process.  There have been no accidents in the past five years.  The facility's safety record is a direct result of the emphasis placed on safety by management and employees alike.



B.  Accidental Release Prevention Policies and Program

This facility strives to meet or exceed compliance with state anhydrous and aqua ammonia regulations.  The company's Environmental, Health & Safety staff provides technical assistance and performs safety and environmental audits on a regular basis.  Training is provided for each new hire and re-hire employee and also on a monthly basis in the form of a monthly safety meeting.  In addition to safety training, employees may be certified in First Aid and CPR.  The ammonia tank(s) and associated equipment are inspected annually following recommended industry and engineering frequencies.  Pressurized tank(s) and plumbing are tested according to the standards for pressure vessel testing. Crop Production Services believes safety and environmental stewardship must be second nature to all employees and contractor personnel.



C.  Emergency Response Policies and Program

Each employee is trained to be familiar with the emergency response policies and procedures through safety reviews and other safety meetings.  This facility has an Emergency Plan which covers accidental releases, natural disasters, security incidents and other emergency response practices and procedures.  The Emergency Plan for this facil

ity is reviewed and updated on an annual basis as part of a comprehensive review process.  The Emergency Plan for this facility includes specific instructions for employees regarding the response procedures to an emergency.  Response procedures may differ by product depending on the qualifications of the personnel and equipment available onsite.  The procedures provided in the Emergency Plan are shared with all employees and followed in the event of an emergency.  Employees are provided refresher training on emergency response on an annual basis.  The local emergency planning committee and fire department personnel are furnished a copy of the Emergency Plan for this facility and invited for a tour on a regular basis.



D.  Worst-Case Scenario/Alternative-Case Scenario  

This facility has developed a worst-case and alternative-case scenario however it has been withheld from this Executive Summary as security-sensitive information as requested by EPA. 



E.  Five Year Accident History

This facility has an excellent safety record with no deaths or serious injuries to any of it's personnel or contractors as a result of the RMP covered process.  In addition, there have been no accidents resulting in releases of ammonia with off-site consequences during the entire operation period.  Extensive programs and procedures are in place to maintain this record.



F.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Crop Production Services and this facility continuously look for ways to enhance the safety of this location.  Monthly safety inspections are conducted which result in corrective actions; annual equipment inspections are also conducted, and detailed Crop Production Services sponsored environmental health & safety audits are conducted at least every three years.  Employees from each branch participate in a safe installation, repair and maintenance of anhydrous ammonia equipment training course.



G.  Summary

The employees of Crop Production Services are extremely proud of our

safety record and vast improvements made in both environmental stewardship and safety over the last twenty-five years.  We believe with our programs and policies in place and with the continued efforts of our personnel, we will maintain our safety record and our safe facility environment for the public, our customers and our employees for years to come.



CES
